title: ARKITEKTKONTO - font ID - sans serif
content:
Looking for an ID on the font used to spell out 'GOA' and 'ARKITEKTKONTO'

Many thanks in advance for any help,  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150423160557im_/http:/typophile.com/files/03cbe295094a04b02bdee9cfb8fe54f4_6091.jpg)

Font: 

 Klim Type - National 

Solved By: 

 [R.](http://web.archive.org/web/20150423160557/http:/typophile.com/user/57325 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [03cbe295094a04b02bdee9cfb8fe54f4.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150423160557/http:/typophile.com/files/03cbe295094a04b02bdee9cfb8fe54f4.jpg) | 30.29 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content: Don't have the name (yet) but still searching. For other font IDers, identity of Goa Arkitektkontor designed by Heydays. Better samples [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150423160557/http:/heydays.no/project/goa-arkitektkontor).

As far as I can see, everything is in [National](http://web.archive.org/web/20150423160557/https:/klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/national/), except for the ‘R’ in ‘ARKITEKTKONTOR’. They might have just modified it.
Good call, R. And thanks too (for my knowledge). I checked only Founders Grotesk and haven't thought to National.
My vote goes for 'Supria Sans', stylistic set 1
That R comes with National as an alternative glyph.
Yes I'm gonna have to re-cast my vote to National (even with the alternate 'g', Supria's lowercase is wrong for this in many other ways)
Nice that you found that alternative ‘R’, Jaer—thanks. Case closed then.
